meanings.definition: Combine two signals to produce a new signal with a frequency equal to the sum or difference of the original frequencies.
meanings.sent1: I will heterodyne the sounds to make a different sound.
meanings.sent2: The radio uses a special technique to heterodyne signals for better reception.
meanings.sent3: When the music and voices were heterodyned, it sounded like a magical tune.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter and the wind seemed to heterodyne into a symphony of joy.
meanings.sent5: The scientist explained how to heterodyne waves in a way that even a child could understand.

meanings.definition: A device that produces heterodyne signals.
meanings.sent1: The heterodyne helped improve the quality of the audio.
meanings.sent2: I bought a new heterodyne for my music system.
meanings.sent3: The little machine made funny noises when the heterodyne was activated.
meanings.sent4: The heterodyne hummed softly, creating a soothing atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The antique heterodyne was a marvel of engineering from a bygone era.

meanings.definition: To mix two signals together to create a new signal.
meanings.sent1: Let's heterodyne these colors to see what we get.
meanings.sent2: The DJ will heterodyne the tracks for a unique remix.
meanings.sent3: She decided to heterodyne the flavors in the recipe for a surprise dish.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to heterodyne the colors into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: Heterodyning the scents of flowers created a delightful fragrance in the room.
